page.title: 13S.P.A.R.E. V S.E.B. (ctd).
page.content: In the meantime S.E.B. found that Newbury did not need the extra electricity.So by 1980 planning permission had lapsed. In 1983 S.E.B.calculated correctly that Newbury did need the electricity, so they took out and dusted up the 1975 plans.But by then the wayleaves were out of date. S.E.B. officials yet again went out and tried to get people to sign more wayleaves but now peoples views had changed and people did not want pylons over their land and destroying the countryside,as 400 trees would have to be felled in the forest,and another 135 to Thatcham. Pylons are ugly,being made of galvanised steel,coated in zinc.They have three arms on each side with insulators like saucers,underneath. This is why S.P.A.R.E. want underground cables,because you cannot
